Regulatory leadership in the region didnâ€™t happen overnight.Saqr Ereiqat, Secretary General of D2A2, breaks down how MENA region became a global force in digital assets.Everyone talks about the rise of crypto in the UAE.But behind the scenes, it started with bold regulatory moves.ADGM was one of the first in the world to roll out digital asset frameworks.BitOasis secured one of the earliest licenses â€” setting a new standard.At the same time, Bahrain played a pioneering role. Its financial regulator issued the first license in the region â€” long before others caught up.Founders were already working directly with central banks.And Bahrainâ€™s legacy in financial services created the right conditions early on.Saqr reminds us:1. The regionâ€™s success didnâ€™t come from hype2. It came from early adoption, regulatory clarity, and institutional trust3. And each jurisdiction brought its own unique strengthsThatâ€™s why MENA region today is a leaderItâ€™s a regulatory trendsetter.Big thank you to Saqr Ereiqat for joining our podcast with my co-host Demetrios Zamboglou PhD.

Branded Real Estate in Dubai: A Trend You Canâ€™t IgnoreThe branded real estate segment is growing rapidly, and Dubai is confidently taking a leading position on the global stage. According to Savills, by 2031 the emirate will host 140 projects of this format â€” more than any other city in the world. Dubai has already surpassed London, New York, and Miami.What is branded real estate?These are residential developments created in partnership with global brands â€” from fashion houses to car manufacturers and hotel chains. Housing with a recognizable logo offers not just a name, but premium design, service, and investment appeal.Why is demand growing? â€¢ Migration of wealthy individuals and increase in the number of HNWIs â€¢ Attractive UAE tax system â€¢ Well-developed infrastructure and high-end lifestyleThe statistics are impressive: â€¢ As of the end of 2024, around 300,000 units are under construction in Dubai, with nearly a third in the luxury segment â€¢ 79% of all branded projects worldwide are developed with hotel brands, two-thirds of which are premium-class â€¢ Dubai has completed 51 branded residence projects, with another 50 under construction â€¢ Demand consistently exceeds supplyWho is shaping the market?Emaar, DAMAC, Omniyat, Sobha, Meraas, Binghatti, and H&H are collaborating with brands like Armani, Versace, Bugatti, Karl Lagerfeld, and Mercedes-Benz. In recent months alone, dozens of new projects have been launched, including Mercedes-Benz Places, Mira Villas by Bentley, and Cavalli Tower. Announced projects include Aman Residences and Jumeirah Asora Bay.What does this mean for investors? â€¢ Up to +30% in value compared to standard developments â€¢ Higher liquidity, brand recognition, service quality, and steady demand â€¢ Increased profitabilityBranded real estate is not just beautiful packaging â€” itâ€™s a functional investment tool, especially in Dubai.

Where Does $1M Go the Furthest in Real Estate? ğŸ¡ğŸ’°When comparing global cities, Dubai offers the most space for your moneyâ€”far more than other top-tier locations:ğŸ“ Monaco â€“ 183 sq. ft.ğŸ“ Hong Kong â€“ 226 sq. ft.ğŸ“ New York â€“ 355 sq. ft.ğŸ“ London & Singapore â€“ 366 sq. ft.ğŸ“ Geneva â€“ 398 sq. ft.ğŸ“ Los Angeles â€“ 420 sq. ft.ğŸ“ Dubai â€“ 1,130 sq. ft. ğŸš€Thatâ€™s 3x-6x more space than in major global financial hubs. But where you invest in Dubai matters just as much as the size of the property you get.Off-Plan vs Secondary â€“ Whatâ€™s the Best Strategy?ğŸ’¡ Off-Plan (New Developments):- Lock in todayâ€™s price with flexible payment plans.- Property appreciates 30-40% by handover (typically in 3 years).- Continues to appreciate 7-10% annually after completion.- Start earning 7-8% rental yield once completed.ğŸ¡ Secondary Market (Ready Properties):- Immediate rental income (7% annual yield).- More stable, but lower capital appreciation (~5-7% per year).- Higher upfront costs and potential maintenance expenses.A Working Example: Off-Plan vs SecondaryğŸ’° Scenario 1: Off-Plan Investment ($1M)âœ… $600K paid over 3 years (60%)âœ… By completion, property value rises to ~$1.35M (35% increase)âœ… Final $400K payment on handoverâœ… Post-handover, property appreciates 7-10% annuallyğŸ“ˆ After 7 years:- Property Value: ~$1.9M - $2.3M- Total Rental Income (Years 4-7): ~$400K- Total Value: $2.3M - $2.7M (2.3x-2.7x return)ğŸ¡ Scenario 2: Secondary Market ($1M Ready Property)âœ… You pay 100% upfrontâœ… Rental income starts immediately at $70K per year (7%)âœ… Property appreciates at ~5-7% per yearğŸ“ˆ After 7 years:- Property Value: ~$1.4M - $1.6M- Total Rental Income: ~$490K- Total Value: $1.9M - $2.1M (1.9x-2.1x return)Key TakeawaysğŸ“Œ Off-Plan Requires Less Upfront Capital (60% during construction)ğŸ“Œ Higher Capital Growth in the Long Run (up to 2.7x return vs 2.1x)ğŸ“Œ Secondary Provides Immediate Cash Flow but lower appreciationğŸ‘‰ The off-plan investment grows faster, requires less upfront capital, and gives you a higher-value asset upon completion.Dubai isnâ€™t just about affordabilityâ€”itâ€™s about strategic investment in a market thatâ€™s growing rapidly.P.S. - Want to learn more about choosing the top real estate opportunities in Dubai? DM for valuable insights & strategies! 0504747283 hashtag#realestate hashtag#wealthmanagement hashtag#investments hashtag#Dubai
